DataElement.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Official Title ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A document, memo or brief that enumerates the differences between two versions of a study protocol document. OTHER NAME(S): Amendment The formal title of the document.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Official Title
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Established by authority or sanction.:An official descriptive name of a document, e.g. the long name of a study protocol provided by the study sponsor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: Established by authority or sanction.:An official descriptive name of a document, e.g. the long name of a study protocol provided by the study sponsor.

Concepts.definition: An official descriptive name of a document, e.g. the long name of a study protocol provided by the study sponsor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
